result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: of Intent to Introduce Statement, Confession Or Admission
to Admit Priors
Final pre-trial on December 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on January 12, 2023 at 08:30 am.

1:29 PM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Merritt A. Parks in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Merritt A. Parks.  Atty Masana received and waives reading of Information, stands mute.  DE advised of charges and penalties.  Court enters Not Guilty Plea, to be set for trial.

2:48 PM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Merritt A. Parks in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Merritt A. Parks.  Court quashes warrant.  State does not object to reinstating previous bond.  Court reinstates previous bond.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2.
Arraignment on August 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Merritt A. Parks not in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Merritt A. Parks.  Atty Masana has no record to make.  State requests a warrant.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant and bond forfeiture proceedings to commence.
Preliminary hearing on June 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.

01:20 PM Defendant Merritt A. Parks in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Masana advises matters are not resolved.  Requests preliminary hearing.  Matter reset.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.
& Notice of Witness List

may not be present at Home Depot in Lake Delton

09:38 AM Defendant Merritt A. Parks in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Merritt A. Parks in custody.  Natalia J Gess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Motion to modify bond.  Atty. Masana states DE in custody for 3 weeks, no violent crimes, would like signature bond.  State objects to signature, recites non appearances.  Court goes thru history of case(s)  22CF110, 22CF131 & 21CF766, committed new crimes when let out.  Court denies motion to modify bond.
Motion hearing on March 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
to Modify Bond

Pre-trial conference on March 18, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Return date on April 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

03:15 PM Defendant Merritt A. Parks by Zoom audio and video from LEC with attorney Allison A Markoski by Zoom audio and video.  Defendant Merritt A. Parks in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE qualifies for public defender representation.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  State recommends $250 cash bond.  Atty Markoski recommends $100 cash bond.  $100.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: May not be present at Home Depot in Lake Delton, WI.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 11:15 am.  Return date scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
